meanings.definition: In name only; not in reality.
meanings.sent1: The club was nominally exclusive, but anyone could join.
meanings.sent2: She held the nominally important title of team captain.
meanings.sent3: The nominally haunted house turned out to be a prank by the neighbors.
meanings.sent4: The nominally calm lake hid dangerous currents beneath its surface.
meanings.sent5: The nominally friendly cat hissed at strangers.

meanings.sent1: He was nominally the leader, but others made all the decisions.
meanings.sent2: The company was nominally successful, but struggling financially.
meanings.sent3: She nominally agreed to the plan, but had no intention of following through.
meanings.sent4: The town was nominally peaceful, yet tension lingered in the air.
meanings.sent5: The cake was nominally sweet, but had a strange aftertaste.
